bcl:definition.bcl:text: Act means the Ecological Reserve Act;
activated e-cigarette has the same meaning as in section 1 of the Tobacco and Vapour Products Control Act;

aircraft means a device in, on or by which a person is transported or drawn by air, whether using a motorized or non-motorized means of propulsion, and includes fixed or rotary wing airplanes and gliders;
camp has the same meaning as in section 1 (1) of the Park, Conservancy and Recreation Area Regulation;
cannabis has the same meaning as in section 1 of the Cannabis Control and Licensing Act;
domesticated animal means an animal that is

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: tame,
under the care or control of a person, or
kept by a person for a commercial purpose;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: drone means an aerial device that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is not occupied or operated by a person within the device, and
is operated by one or more of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: onboard computer autonomy or artificial intelligence;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: e-cigarette has the same meaning as in section 1 of the Tobacco and Vapour Products Control Act;
e-substance has the same meaning as in section 1 of the Tobacco and Vapour Products Control Act;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a vertebrate of the order Petromyzontiformes (lampreys) or class Osteichthyes (bony fishes);
an invertebrate of the phylum Echinodermata (echinoderms), class Crustacea (crustaceans) or class Mollusca (mollusks);
any other aquatic animal, except a bird or mammal;
an egg or juvenile stage of an animal described in any of paragraphs (a) to (c);

bcl:definition.bcl:text: hunt has the same meaning as in section 1 (1) of the Park, Conservancy and Recreation Area Regulation;
motorized boat means a device in, on or by which a person is transported or drawn on water using a motorized means of propulsion;
natural resources has the same meaning as in section 1 of the Park Act;
non-motorized boat means a device in, on or by which a person is transported or drawn on water using a non-motorized means of propulsion;
tobacco has the same meaning as in section 1 of the Tobacco and Vapour Products Control Act;
trap has the same meaning as in section 1 (1) of the Park, Conservancy and Recreation Area Regulation;
vehicle means a device in, on or by which a person or thing is transported or drawn on land, whether using a motorized or non-motorized means of propulsion;
waste has the same meaning as in section 1 (1) of the Environmental Management Act;
wildlife has the same meaning as in section 1 (1) of the Park, Conservancy and Recreation Area Regulation.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Ecological reserve entry, use and occupation restricted

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to this section, a person must not enter, use or occupy an ecological reserve unless authorized by a permit issued under section 5.1 (1) of the Act.
A person may, without a permit, enter and travel in or through, by foot or by non-motorized boat, an ecological reserve other than an ecological reserve set out in the Schedule.

Subsection (2) does not authorize entry to an ecological reserve if a heat or rainfall warning issued by Environment and Climate Change Canada is in effect in relation to an area that encompasses, overlaps with or abuts the ecological reserve.
A permittee must comply with the terms and conditions included in the permittee's permit under section 5.1 (5) of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The minister must, if satisfied that the circumstances set out in section 2 (3) exist in relation to an ecological reserve, provide public notice, in the manner the minister considers appropriate, that entry to the ecological reserve is prohibited under section 2 unless authorized by a permit.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 5.1 (1) of the Act, a person may apply to the minister for a permit authorizing the use and occupation of an ecological reserve for ecological scientific research or educational purposes.
An application for a permit must include the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a description of the proposed scientific research or educational uses and activities;
a description and map of the areas of land that would be affected by the uses and activities;
a description of the proposed means of entry to and access through the ecological reserve;
the proposed duration of the uses and activities;
the expected ecological impact of the uses and activities;
the number of individuals proposed to enter the ecological reserve and, if known, their names;
the name of the individual proposed to direct the uses and activities.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister is not required to hold a hearing before suspending, modifying or cancelling a permit.
If the minister holds a hearing, it may be held in writing, electronically or in person, or by any combination of written, electronic or in-person hearings.
A person must not do or attempt to do any of the following in an ecological reserve:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: prospect or explore for, or extract, coal, petroleum or natural gas;
drill for or divert water or dam a waterway.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person must not do or attempt to do any of the following unless authorized to do so under a permit issued under section 5.1 (1) of the Act:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: introduce a plant or animal species in an ecological reserve;
operate a vehicle or a motorized boat, or conduct a take-off or landing of an aircraft or a drone, in an ecological reserve;
deposit waste in an ecological reserve;
allow or cause waste to flow onto or seep into land in an ecological reserve or to flow or seep into water in an ecological reserve;
allow or cause waste to be emitted into the air from within an ecological reserve;
mine or quarry earth, soil, peat, marl, sand, gravel, rock or another mineral resource in an ecological reserve;
make an alteration to land on or beneath its surface in an ecological reserve;
damage, destroy or take a sample of a natural resource in, or remove a natural resource from, an ecological reserve;
disturb an animal in an ecological reserve;
hunt or trap in, catch fish in, or take fish or wildlife from, an ecological reserve;

touch or feed wildlife in an ecological reserve or entice wildlife in an ecological reserve to approach by any means, including by holding out or setting out a decoy, lure, food or bait or by using a wildlife caller;
light, fuel or use a fire in an ecological reserve;
allow a domesticated animal to graze in an ecological reserve;
cut or fell timber in an ecological reserve;
construct or modify a road or trail in an ecological reserve;
camp in an ecological reserve;
establish, construct or modify a building or other structure in an ecological reserve;
smoke cannabis, or hold lighted cannabis, in an ecological reserve;
use or hold, in an ecological reserve, an activated e-cigarette that is vapourizing cannabis;
smoke tobacco, or hold lighted tobacco, in an ecological reserve;
use or hold, in an ecological reserve, an activated e-cigarette that is vapourizing an e-substance other than cannabis.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section does not apply in relation to a use or activity carried out

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: under section 18 of the Wildfire Act, or
by or on behalf of the minister for the purposes of one or more of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: protecting a rare or endangered native plant or animal;
carrying out ecological scientific research or education.

bcl:section.bcl:text: A person who contravenes any of the following commits an offence:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: section 2 (1) or (4);
section 6 (1) or (2).

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Ecological Reserve Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 103, s. 7.]
